t: John 1
The Deity of Jesus Christ
In*p the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
He was in the beginning with God.
All things came into being through Him, and apart from Him nothing came into being that has come into being.
In Him was life, and the life was the Light of men.
The Light shines in the darkness, and the darkness did not comprehend it.
The Witness John
There*p came a man sent from God, whose name was John.
He came as a witness, to testify about the Light, so that all might believe through him.
He was not the Light, but he*i came*i to testify about the Light.
There*p was the true Light which, coming into the world, enlightens every man.
He was in the world, and the world was made through Him, and the world did not know Him.
He came to His own, and those who were His own did not receive Him.
But as many as received Him, to them He gave the right to become children of God, even*i to those who believe in His name,
who were born, not of blood nor of the will of the flesh nor of the will of man, but of God.
The Word Made Flesh
And*p the Word became flesh, and dwelt among us, and we saw His glory, glory as of the only begotten from the Father, full of grace and truth.
John testified about Him and cried out, saying, “This was He of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me has a higher rank than I, for He existed before me.’ ”
For of His fullness we have all received, and grace upon grace.
For the Law was given through Moses; grace and truth were realized through Jesus Christ.
No one has seen God at any time; the only begotten God who is in the bosom of the Father, He has explained Him.*i
The Testimony of John
This*p is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent to him priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
And he confessed and did not deny, but confessed, “I am not the Christ.”
They asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?” And he said, “I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?” And he answered, “No.”
Then they said to him, “Who are you, so that we may give an answer to those who sent us? What do you say about yourself?”
He said, “I am a*s voice*s of*s one*s crying*s in*s the*s wilderness,*s ‘Make*s straight*s the*s way*s of*s the*s Lord,’*s as Isaiah the prophet said.”
Now*p they had been sent from the Pharisees.
They asked him, and said to him, “Why then are you baptizing, if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”
John answered them saying, “I baptize in water, but*i among you stands One whom you do not know.
It*i is*i He who comes after me, the thong of whose sandal I am not worthy to untie.”
These things took place in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
The*p next day he saw Jesus coming to him and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
This is He on behalf of whom I said, ‘After me comes a Man who has a higher rank than I, for He existed before me.’
I did not recognize Him, but so that He might be manifested to Israel, I came baptizing in water.”
John testified saying, “I have seen the Spirit descending as a dove out of heaven, and He remained upon Him.
I did not recognize Him, but He who sent me to baptize in water said to me, ‘He upon whom you see the Spirit descending and remaining upon Him, this is the One who baptizes in the Holy Spirit.’
I myself have seen, and have testified that this is the Son of God.”
Jesus’ Public Ministry, First Converts
Again*p the next day John was standing with two of his disciples,
and he looked at Jesus as He walked, and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God!”
The two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
And Jesus turned and saw them following, and said to them, “What*r do*r you*r seek?”*r They said to Him, “Rabbi (which translated means Teacher), where are You staying?”
He said to them, “Come,*r and*r you*r will*r see.”*r So they came and saw where He was staying; and they stayed with Him that day, for it was about the tenth hour.
One of the two who heard John speak*i and followed Him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.
He found first his own brother Simon and said to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which translated means Christ).
He brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, “You*r are*r Simon*r the*r son*r of*r John;*r you*r shall*r be*r called*r Cephas”*r (which is translated Peter).
The*p next day He purposed to go into Galilee, and He found Philip. And Jesus said to him, “Follow*r Me.”*r
Now Philip was from Bethsaida, of the city of Andrew and Peter.
Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found Him of whom Moses in the Law and also*i the Prophets wrote—Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
Nathanael said to him, “Can any good thing come out of Nazareth?” Philip said to him, “Come and see.”
Jesus saw Nathanael coming to Him, and said of him, “Behold,*r an*r Israelite*r indeed,*r in*r whom*r there*r is*r no*r deceit!”*r
Nathanael said to Him, “How do You know me?” Jesus answered and said to him, “Before*r Philip*r called*r you,*r when*r you*r were*r under*r the*r fig*r tree,*r I*r saw*r you.”*r
Nathanael answered Him, “Rabbi, You are the Son of God; You are the King of Israel.”
Jesus answered and said to him, “Because*r I*r said*r to*r you*r that*r I*r saw*r you*r under*r the*r fig*r tree,*r do*r you*r believe?*r You*r will*r see*r greater*r things*r than*r these.”*r
And He said to him, “Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r you*r will*r see*r the*r heavens*r opened*r and*r the*r angels*r of*r God*r ascending*r and*r descending*r on*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.”*r
John 2
Miracle at Cana
On*p the third day there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there;
and both Jesus and His disciples were invited to the wedding.
When the wine ran out, the mother of Jesus said to Him, “They have no wine.”
And Jesus said to her, “Woman,*r what*r does*r that*r have*r to*r do*r with*r us?*r My*r hour*r has*r not*r yet*r come.”*r
His mother said to the servants, “Whatever He says to you, do it.”
Now there were six stone waterpots set there for the Jewish custom of purification, containing twenty or thirty gallons each.
Jesus said to them, “Fill*r the*r waterpots*r with*r water.”*r So they filled them up to the brim.
And He said to them, “Draw*r some*ir out*r now*r and*r take*r it*r to*r the*r headwaiter.”*r So they took it to*i him.*i
When the headwaiter tasted the water which had become wine, and did not know where it came from (but the servants who had drawn the water knew), the headwaiter called the bridegroom,
and said to him, “Every man serves the good wine first, and when the*i people*i have drunk freely, then*i he*i serves*i the poorer wine;*i but*i you have kept the good wine until now.”
This beginning of His*i signs Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and manifested His glory, and His disciples believed in Him.
After*p this He went down to Capernaum, He and His mother and His*i brothers and His disciples; and they stayed there a few days.
First Passover—Cleansing the Temple
The*p Passover of the Jews was near, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
And He found in the temple those who were selling oxen and sheep and doves, and the money changers seated at*i their*i tables.*i
And He made a scourge of cords, and drove them*i all out of the temple, with the sheep and the oxen; and He poured out the coins of the money changers and overturned their tables;
and to those who were selling the doves He said, “Take*r these*r things*r away;*r stop*r making*r My*r Father’s*r house*r a*r place*r of*r business.”*r
His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal*s for*s Your*s house*s will*s consume*s me.”*s
The Jews then said to Him, “What sign do You show us as your authority for doing these things?”
Jesus answered them, “Destroy*r this*r temple,*r and*r in*r three*r days*r I*r will*r raise*r it*r up.”*r
The Jews then said, “It took forty-six years to build this temple, and will You raise it up in three days?”
But He was speaking of the temple of His body.
So when He was raised from the dead, His disciples remembered that He said this; and they believed the Scripture and the word which Jesus had spoken.
Now*p when He was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast, many believed in His name, observing His signs which He was doing.
But Jesus, on His part, was not entrusting Himself to them, for He knew all men,
and because He did not need anyone to testify concerning man, for He Himself knew what was in man.
John 3
The New Birth
Now*p there was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews;
this man came to Jesus by night and said to Him, “Rabbi, we know that You have come from God as*i a teacher; for no one can do these signs that You do unless God is with him.”
Jesus answered and said to him, “Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r unless*r one*r is*r born*r again*r he*r cannot*r see*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
Nicodemus*p said to Him, “How can a man be born when he is old? He cannot enter a second time into his mother’s womb and be born, can he?”
Jesus answered, “Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r unless*r one*r is*r born*r of*r water*r and*r the*r Spirit*r he*r cannot*r enter*r into*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
That*r which*r is*r born*r of*r the*r flesh*r is*r flesh,*r and*r that*r which*r is*r born*r of*r the*r Spirit*r is*r spirit.*r
Do*r not*r be*r amazed*r that*r I*r said*r to*r you,*r ‘You*r must*r be*r born*r again.’*r

The*r wind*r blows*r where*r it*r wishes*r and*r you*r hear*r the*r sound*r of*r it,*r but*r do*r not*r know*r where*r it*r comes*r from*r and*r where*r it*r is*r going;*r so*r is*r everyone*r who*r is*r born*r of*r the*r Spirit.”*r
Nicodemus*p said to Him, “How can these things be?”
Jesus answered and said to him, “Are*r you*r the*r teacher*r of*r Israel*r and*r do*r not*r understand*r these*r things?*r
Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r we*r speak*r of*r what*r we*r know*r and*r testify*r of*r what*r we*r have*r seen,*r and*r you*r do*r not*r accept*r our*r testimony.*r
If*r I*r told*r you*r earthly*r things*r and*r you*r do*r not*r believe,*r how*r will*r you*r believe*r if*r I*r tell*r you*r heavenly*r things?*r
No*r one*r has*r ascended*r into*r heaven,*r but*r He*r who*r descended*r from*r heaven:*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.*r
As*r Moses*r lifted*r up*r the*r serpent*r in*r the*r wilderness,*r even*r so*r must*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r be*r lifted*r up;*r
so*r that*r whoever*r believes*r will*r in*r Him*r have*r eternal*r life.*r
“For*rp God*r so*r loved*r the*r world,*r that*r He*r gave*r His*r only*r begotten*r Son,*r that*r whoever*r believes*r in*r Him*r shall*r not*r perish,*r but*r have*r eternal*r life.*r
For*r God*r did*r not*r send*r the*r Son*r into*r the*r world*r to*r judge*r the*r world,*r but*r that*r the*r world*r might*r be*r saved*r through*r Him.*r

He*r who*r believes*r in*r Him*r is*r not*r judged;*r he*r who*r does*r not*r believe*r has*r been*r judged*r already,*r because*r he*r has*r not*r believed*r in*r the*r name*r of*r the*r only*r begotten*r Son*r of*r God.*r
This*r is*r the*r judgment,*r that*r the*r Light*r has*r come*r into*r the*r world,*r and*r men*r loved*r the*r darkness*r rather*r than*r the*r Light,*r for*r their*r deeds*r were*r evil.*r
For*r everyone*r who*r does*r evil*r hates*r the*r Light,*r and*r does*r not*r come*r to*r the*r Light*r for*r fear*r that*r his*r deeds*r will*r be*r exposed.*r
But*r he*r who*r practices*r the*r truth*r comes*r to*r the*r Light,*r so*r that*r his*r deeds*r may*r be*r manifested*r as*r having*r been*r wrought*r in*r God.”*r
John’s Last Testimony
After*p these things Jesus and His disciples came into the land of Judea, and there He was spending time with them and baptizing.
John also was baptizing in Aenon near Salim, because there was much water there; and people*i were coming and were being baptized—
for John had not yet been thrown into prison.
Therefore*p there arose a discussion on the part of John’s disciples with a Jew about purification.
And they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, He who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have testified, behold, He is baptizing and all are coming to Him.”
John answered and said, “A man can receive nothing unless it has been given him from heaven.
You yourselves are my witnesses that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent ahead of Him.’
He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. So this joy of mine has been made full.
He must increase, but I must decrease.
“He*p who comes from above is above all, he who is of the earth is from the earth and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all.
What He has seen and heard, of that He testifies; and no one receives His testimony.
He who has received His testimony has set his seal to this,*i that God is true.
For He whom God has sent speaks the words of God; for He gives the Spirit without measure.
The Father loves the Son and has given all things into His hand.
He who believes in the Son has eternal life; but he who does not obey the Son will not see life, but the wrath of God abides on him.”
John 4
Jesus Goes to Galilee
Therefore*p when the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John
(although Jesus Himself was not baptizing, but His disciples were),
He left Judea and went away again into Galilee.
And He had to pass through Samaria.
So He came to a city of Samaria called Sychar, near the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph;
and Jacob’s well was there. So Jesus, being wearied from His journey, was sitting thus by the well. It was about the sixth hour.
The Woman of Samaria
There*p came a woman of Samaria to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give*r Me*r a*r drink.”*r
For His disciples had gone away into the city to buy food.
Therefore the Samaritan woman said to Him, “How is it that You, being a Jew, ask me for a drink since I am a Samaritan woman?” (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)

Jesus answered and said to her, “If*r you*r knew*r the*r gift*r of*r God,*r and*r who*r it*r is*r who*r says*r to*r you,*r ‘Give*r Me*r a*r drink,’*r you*r would*r have*r asked*r Him,*r and*r He*r would*r have*r given*r you*r living*r water.”*r
She said to Him, “Sir, You have nothing to draw with and the well is deep; where then do You get that living water?
You are not greater than our father Jacob, are You, who gave us the well, and drank of it himself and his sons and his cattle?”
Jesus answered and said to her, “Everyone*r who*r drinks*r of*r this*r water*r will*r thirst*r again;*r

but*r whoever*r drinks*r of*r the*r water*r that*r I*r will*r give*r him*r shall*r never*r thirst;*r but*r the*r water*r that*r I*r will*r give*r him*r will*r become*r in*r him*r a*r well*r of*r water*r springing*r up*r to*r eternal*r life.”*r
The*p woman said to Him, “Sir, give me this water, so I will not be thirsty nor come all the way here to draw.”
He said to her, “Go,*r call*r your*r husband*r and*r come*r here.”*r
The woman answered and said, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You*r have*r correctly*r said,*r ‘I*r have*r no*r husband’;*r
for*r you*r have*r had*r five*r husbands,*r and*r the*r one*r whom*r you*r now*r have*r is*r not*r your*r husband;*r this*r you*r have*r said*r truly.”*r
The woman said to Him, “Sir, I perceive that You are a prophet.
Our fathers worshiped in this mountain, and you people*i say that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.”
Jesus said to her, “Woman,*r believe*r Me,*r an*r hour*r is*r coming*r when*r neither*r in*r this*r mountain*r nor*r in*r Jerusalem*r will*r you*r worship*r the*r Father.*r
You*r worship*r what*r you*r do*r not*r know;*r we*r worship*r what*r we*r know,*r for*r salvation*r is*r from*r the*r Jews.*r

But*r an*r hour*r is*r coming,*r and*r now*r is,*r when*r the*r true*r worshipers*r will*r worship*r the*r Father*r in*r spirit*r and*r truth;*r for*r such*r people*r the*r Father*r seeks*r to*r be*r His*r worshipers.*r
God*r is*r spirit,*r and*r those*r who*r worship*r Him*r must*r worship*r in*r spirit*r and*r truth.”*r
The woman said to Him, “I know that Messiah is coming (He who is called Christ); when that One comes, He will declare all things to us.”
Jesus said to her, “I*r who*r speak*r to*r you*r am*r He.”*ir
At*p this point His disciples came, and they were amazed that He had been speaking with a woman, yet no one said, “What do You seek?” or, “Why do You speak with her?”
So the woman left her waterpot, and went into the city and said to the men,
“Come, see a man who told me all the things that I have*i done; this is not the Christ, is it?”
They went out of the city, and were coming to Him.
Meanwhile*p the disciples were urging Him, saying, “Rabbi, eat.”
But He said to them, “I*r have*r food*r to*r eat*r that*r you*r do*r not*r know*r about.”*r
So the disciples were saying to one another, “No one brought Him anything*i to eat, did he?”
Jesus said to them, “My*r food*r is*r to*r do*r the*r will*r of*r Him*r who*r sent*r Me*r and*r to*r accomplish*r His*r work.*r

Do*r you*r not*r say,*r ‘There*r are*r yet*r four*r months,*r and*r then*ir comes*r the*r harvest’?*r Behold,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r lift*r up*r your*r eyes*r and*r look*r on*r the*r fields,*r that*r they*r are*r white*r for*r harvest.*r
Already*r he*r who*r reaps*r is*r receiving*r wages*r and*r is*r gathering*r fruit*r for*r life*r eternal;*r so*r that*r he*r who*r sows*r and*r he*r who*r reaps*r may*r rejoice*r together.*r
For*r in*r this*r case*ir the*r saying*r is*r true,*r ‘One*r sows*r and*r another*r reaps.’*r
I*r sent*r you*r to*r reap*r that*r for*r which*r you*r have*r not*r labored;*r others*r have*r labored*r and*r you*r have*r entered*r into*r their*r labor.”*r
The Samaritans
From*p that city many of the Samaritans believed in Him because of the word of the woman who testified, “He told me all the things that I have*i done.”
So when the Samaritans came to Jesus, they were asking Him to stay with them; and He stayed there two days.
Many more believed because of His word;
and they were saying to the woman, “It is no longer because of what you said that we believe, for we have heard for ourselves and know that this One is indeed the Savior of the world.”
After*p the two days He went forth from there into Galilee.
For Jesus Himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.
So when He came to Galilee, the Galileans received Him, having seen all the things that He did in Jerusalem at the feast; for they themselves also went to the feast.
Healing a Nobleman’s Son
Therefore*p He came again to Cana of Galilee where He had made the water wine. And there was a royal official whose son was sick at Capernaum.
When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to Him and was imploring Him*i to come down and heal his son; for he was at the point of death.
So Jesus said to him, “Unless*r you*r people*ir see*r signs*r and*r wonders,*r you*r simply*ir will*r not*r believe.”*r
The royal official said to Him, “Sir, come down before my child dies.”
Jesus said to him, “Go;*r your*r son*r lives.”*r The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him and started off.
As he was now going down, his*i slaves met him, saying that his son was living.
So he inquired of them the hour when he began to get better. Then they said to him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.”
So the father knew that it*i was*i at that hour in which Jesus said to him, “Your*r son*r lives”;*r and he himself believed and his whole household.
This is again a second sign that Jesus performed when He had come out of Judea into Galilee.
John 5
The Healing at Bethesda
After*p these things there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
Now*p there is in Jerusalem by the sheep gate*i a pool, which is called in Hebrew Bethesda, having five porticoes.
In these lay a multitude of those who were sick, blind, lame, and withered, [waiting for the moving of the waters;

for an angel of the Lord went down at certain seasons into the pool and stirred up the water; whoever then first, after the stirring up of the water, stepped in was made well from whatever disease with which he was afflicted.]
A man was there who had been ill for thirty-eight years.
When Jesus saw him lying there,*i and knew that he had already been a long time in*i that*i condition,*i He said to him, “Do*r you*r wish*r to*r get*r well?”*r
The sick man answered Him, “Sir, I have no man to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up, but while I am coming, another steps down before me.”
Jesus said to him, “Get*r up,*r pick*r up*r your*r pallet*r and*r walk.”*r
Immediately the man became well, and picked up his pallet and began*i to walk. Now*bp it was the Sabbath on that day.
So the Jews were saying to the man who was cured, “It is the Sabbath, and it is not permissible for you to carry your pallet.”
But he answered them, “He who made me well was the one who said to me, ‘Pick*r up*r your*r pallet*r and*r walk.’”*r
They asked him, “Who is the man who said to you, ‘Pick*r up*r your*ir pallet*ir and*r walk’?”*r
But the man who was healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had slipped away while there was a crowd in that*i place.
Afterward Jesus found him in the temple and said to him, “Behold,*r you*r have*r become*r well;*r do*r not*r sin*r anymore,*r so*r that*r nothing*r worse*r happens*r to*r you.”*r
The man went away, and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.
For this reason the Jews were persecuting Jesus, because He was doing these things on the Sabbath.
But He answered them, “My*r Father*r is*r working*r until*r now,*r and*r I*r Myself*r am*r working.”*r
Jesus’ Equality with God
For*p this reason therefore the Jews were seeking all the more to kill Him, because He not only was breaking the Sabbath, but also was calling God His own Father, making Himself equal with God.

Therefore*p Jesus answered and was saying to them, “Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r the*r Son*r can*r do*r nothing*r of*r Himself,*r unless*r it*ir is*ir something*r He*r sees*r the*r Father*r doing;*r for*r whatever*r the*r Father*r does,*r these*r things*r the*r Son*r also*r does*r in*r like*r manner.*r

For*r the*r Father*r loves*r the*r Son,*r and*r shows*r Him*r all*r things*r that*r He*r Himself*r is*r doing;*r and*r the*ir Father*ir will*r show*r Him*r greater*r works*r than*r these,*r so*r that*r you*r will*r marvel.*r
For*r just*r as*r the*r Father*r raises*r the*r dead*r and*r gives*r them*r life,*r even*r so*r the*r Son*r also*r gives*r life*r to*r whom*r He*r wishes.*r
For*r not*r even*r the*r Father*r judges*r anyone,*r but*r He*r has*r given*r all*r judgment*r to*r the*r Son,*r
so*r that*r all*r will*r honor*r the*r Son*r even*r as*r they*r honor*r the*r Father.*r He*r who*r does*r not*r honor*r the*r Son*r does*r not*r honor*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r Him.*r

“Truly,*rp truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r he*r who*r hears*r My*r word,*r and*r believes*r Him*r who*r sent*r Me,*r has*r eternal*r life,*r and*r does*r not*r come*r into*r judgment,*r but*r has*r passed*r out*r of*r death*r into*r life.*r
Two Resurrections

Truly,*rp truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r an*r hour*r is*r coming*r and*r now*r is,*r when*r the*r dead*r will*r hear*r the*r voice*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r God,*r and*r those*r who*r hear*r will*r live.*r
For*r just*r as*r the*r Father*r has*r life*r in*r Himself,*r even*r so*r He*r gave*r to*r the*r Son*r also*r to*r have*r life*r in*r Himself;*r
and*r He*r gave*r Him*r authority*r to*r execute*r judgment,*r because*r He*r is*r the*ir Son*r of*r Man.*r
Do*r not*r marvel*r at*r this;*r for*r an*r hour*r is*r coming,*r in*r which*r all*r who*r are*r in*r the*r tombs*r will*r hear*r His*r voice,*r
